text: I’m looking through the schedule from this morning and wanted to clarify when Melodee and I should aim to be wrapped up on Dx visuals by. I see two phases for Aperture Design… and wasn’t sure if we fell into the first category or the second. We think we’re on track deadline-wise but wanted to ask for any potential feedback if others felt differently based on what we’ve been sharing so far.

Hey <!channel>, Melodee and I have set up a system to hopefully better inform you all of our progress on a more incremental manner. We’ll be uploading content frequently, ideally on a daily basis, to a group Google Drive folder only viewable to those with Uncorked emails and the link to protect the vulnerability of our in-progress work. We’ll also be sharing in this channel quick lists of features we’ve worked on since out last posting so you know what to look for. And as we produce more substantial iterations we’ll be printing/pinning those to the foam board in Social Space too.

We hope this will give everyone a chance to be better informed ahead of time, come into visual check in meetings with fewer surprises, and help engage in a more focused feedback loop we’re hoping for to keep moving forward.

Head on over to <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1KFvQr_SwVvRklOMUE1dEhfb1E> to keep up on the latest (and hit me up if you need access). Thanks everyone!

Today and yesterday I worked more on the enrollment screen (5.1.1, 5.1.2, 5.1.3) creating more contrast/hierarchy and trying to make the previews feel like previews. I also worked a lot today on the frequency screens. Added a screen to select days and changing the shape from circles to polygons. Other minor tweaks like button positions and language. I also changed the time picker to be even more custom, I am still working to make it feel more minimal. Tomorrow, I want to finish the time picker and continue on session view screen.
Also, <@U026103R3>, curious to hear your take on the previous question of mine from earlier
only have time at moment to peek while in a different meeting, but wanted to say some of the updates look really great <@U0MKH0BE0>
yeah she’s killing it

Compass Dx Visual Progress:
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1KFvQr_SwVvRklOMUE1dEhfb1E>
again, early thoughts that are completely without context — I maintain the question on scheduling time. What the balance between uniqueness, pacing, custom needs AND familiar patterns?

text: <@U026E0ZNR|trent> pinned a message to this channel.
like - does the unique aspects of setting a time outweigh the benefit of familiarity of time setting?
I honestly don’t know my opinion at moment. It LOOKS great

^ talked with trent/melodee about that exact thing today. I definitely want us to explore alternatives to the native pattern but at the end of the day it has to be clear over clever. I think melodee is still in exploration mode.
*zepp motto alert*
and yes, that is very much in progress, we discussed it before she headed out and she wants to do more on it as she mentioned in her recap
shit i forgot that came from zepp
damnit
helpful points though on the higher level questioning of straying from familiarity, we’ll be sure to discuss it more tomorrow
sorry - had to step away
just chiming in from afar
and again, love the look, love the exploration - not at all saying we shouldn’t be pushing.
should have started with — awesome work.
:wink:
I took just a quick look tonight & think they are looking so good. Also, super appreciate you guys finding new ways to share progress. That’s a great way for us to stay in sync
+1 to that ^^^
THANK YOU

Just uploaded my work from today.
_Note: Shorter screen is before user scrolls down to have clipping shrink today’s card to landscape list view, falling into line with future sessions._

Today I did:
• Re-cropped list modules into landscape instead of portrait
• Played with numeral type
• Aligned typography/layout on list view cards more with Up Next screen
• Pushed spacing of cards on list view
• Altered top nav bar color/overall progress bar

Still working:
• To think about subbing other shapes for circles
• To figure out how to apply More Info to list view cards & apply to Up Next also
• To revisit Completed section scale, iconography, re-play options
Man somehow slack never notified me of this - sounds good on the plan above! Thanks for sharing WIP!
